org.jamesframework.core.search

Class NeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.Search<SolutionType>
      • org.jamesframework.core.search.NeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType>
  • Type Parameters:
    SolutionType - solution type of the problems that may be solved using this search, required to extend Solution
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleNeighbourhoodSearch

    public abstract class NeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>
extends Search<SolutionType>
    A neighbourhood search extends the general abstract search by adding a concept of current solution, which is repeatedly modified by applying moves generated by a neighbourhood. The initial solution may be specified using setCurrentSolution(Solution) before running the search, else, a random initial solution will be constructed. A neighbourhood search contains additional metadata that applies to the current run only: the number of accepted and rejected moves. All other data is retained across subsequent runs, including the current solution and its evaluation. This means that upon restarting a neighbourhood search, it will continue from where it had arrived in the previous run.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Method Detail

      • setEvaluatedMoveCache

        public void setEvaluatedMoveCache(EvaluatedMoveCache cache)
        Sets a custom evaluated move cache. By default, a SingleEvaluatedMoveCache is used. Note that this method may only be called when the search is idle. If the cache is set to null, no caching will be applied.
        Parameters:
        cache - custom evaluated move cache
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the search is not idle

      • searchStarted

        protected void searchStarted()
        Resets neighbourhood search specific, per run metadata: number of accepted and rejected moves.
        Overrides:
        searchStarted in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>

      • addSearchListener

        public boolean addSearchListener(SearchListener<? super SolutionType> listener)
        Add a search listener, if not already added before. Passes the listener to its parent (general search), but also stores it locally in case it is a neighbourhood search listener for neighbourhood search specific callbacks. Note that this method may only be called when the search is idle.
        Overrides:
        addSearchListener in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>
        Parameters:
        listener - search listener to add to the search
        Returns:
        true if the search listener had not been added before
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the search is not idle

      • removeSearchListener

        public boolean removeSearchListener(SearchListener<? super SolutionType> listener)
        Remove the given search listener. If the search listener had not been added, false is returned. Calls its parent (general search) to remove the listener, and also removes it locally in case it is a neighbourhood search listener. Note that this method may only be called when the search is idle.
        Overrides:
        removeSearchListener in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>
        Parameters:
        listener - search listener to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the listener has been successfully removed
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the search is not idle

      • getNumAcceptedMoves

        public long getNumAcceptedMoves()

        Get the number of moves accepted during the current (or last) run. The precise return value depends on the status of the search:

        • If the search is either RUNNING or TERMINATING, this method returns the number of moves accepted since the current run was started.
        • If the search is IDLE, the total number of moves accepted during the last run is returned, if any. Before the first run, JamesConstants.INVALID_MOVE_COUNT.
        • While INITIALIZING the current run, JamesConstants.INVALID_MOVE_COUNT is returned.

        The return value is always positive, except in those cases when JamesConstants.INVALID_MOVE_COUNT is returned.

        Returns:
        number of moves accepted during the current (or last) run

      • getNumRejectedMoves

        public long getNumRejectedMoves()

        Get the number of moves rejected during the current (or last) run. The precise return value depends on the status of the search:

        • If the search is either RUNNING or TERMINATING, this method returns the number of moves rejected since the current run was started.
        • If the search is IDLE, the total number of moves rejected during the last run is returned, if any. Before the first run, JamesConstants.INVALID_MOVE_COUNT.
        • While INITIALIZING the current run, JamesConstants.INVALID_MOVE_COUNT is returned.

        The return value is always positive, except in those cases when JamesConstants.INVALID_MOVE_COUNT is returned.

        Returns:
        number of moves rejected during the current (or last) run

      • getCurrentSolution

        public SolutionType getCurrentSolution()
        Returns the current solution. The current solution might be worse than the best solution found so far. Note that it is retained across subsequent runs of the same search. May return null if no current solution has been set yet, for example when the search has just been created or is still initializing the current run.
        Returns:
        current solution, if set; null otherwise

      • getCurrentSolutionEvaluation

        public double getCurrentSolutionEvaluation()
        Get the evaluation of the current solution. The current solution and its evaluation are retained across subsequent runs of the same search. If the current solution is not yet defined, i.e. when getCurrentSolution() return null, the result of this method is undefined; in such case it may return any arbitrary value.
        Returns:
        evaluation of current solution, if already defined; arbitrary value otherwise

      • setCurrentSolution

        public void setCurrentSolution(SolutionType solution)
        Sets the current solution. The given solution is automatically evaluated and compared with the currently known best solution, to check if it improves on this solution. This method may for example be used to specify a custom initial solution before starting the search. Note that it may only be called when the search is idle.

        Clears the evaluated move cache, as this cache is no longer valid for the new current solution.

        Parameters:
        solution - current solution to be adopted
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the search is not idle
        NullPointerException - if solution is null

      • evaluateMove

        protected double evaluateMove(Move<? super SolutionType> move)
        Evaluates the neighbour obtained by applying the given move to the current solution. If this move has been evaluated before and the computed value is still available in the cache, the cached value will be returned. Else, the evaluation will be computed and offered to the cache.
        Parameters:
        move - move applied to the current solution
        Returns:
        evaluation of obtained neighbour, possibly retrieved from the evaluated move cache

      • validateMove

        protected boolean validateMove(Move<? super SolutionType> move)
        Validates the neighbour obtained by applying the given move to the current solution. If this move has been validated before and the result is still available in the cache, the cached result will be returned. Else, the neighbour will be validated and the result is offered to the cache.
        Parameters:
        move - move applied to the current solution
        Returns:
        true if the obtained neighbour is not rejected, possibly retrieved from the evaluated move cache

      • isImprovement

        protected boolean isImprovement(Move<? super SolutionType> move)
        Checks whether the given move leads to an improvement when being applied to the current solution. An improvement is made if and only if the given move is not null, the neighbour obtained by applying the move is not rejected (see Problem.rejectSolution(Solution)) and this neighbour has a better evaluation than the current solution (i.e. a positive delta is observed, see Search.computeDelta(double, double)).

        Note that computed values are cached to prevent multiple evaluations or validations of the same move.

        Parameters:
        move - move to be applied to the current solution
        Returns:
        true if applying this move yields an improvement

      • getMoveWithLargestDelta

        protected Move<? super SolutionType> getMoveWithLargestDelta(Collection<? extends Move<? super SolutionType>> moves,
                                                 boolean positiveDeltasOnly)
        Given a collection of possible moves, get the move which yields the largest delta (see Search.computeDelta(double, double)) when applying it to the current solution, where only those moves leading to a valid neighbour are considered (those moves for which Problem.rejectSolution(Solution) returns false). If positiveDeltasOnly is set to true, only moves yielding a (strictly) positive delta, i.e. an improvement, are considered. May return null if all moves lead to invalid solutions, or if no valid move with positive delta is found, in case positiveDeltasOnly is set to true.

        Note that all computed values are cached to prevent multiple evaluations or validations of the same move. Before returning the selected "best" move, if any, its evaluation and validity are cached again to maximize the probability that these values will remain available in the cache.

        Parameters:
        moves - collection of possible moves
        positiveDeltasOnly - if set to true, only moves with delta > 0 are considered
        Returns:
        valid move with largest delta, may be null

      • acceptMove

        protected void acceptMove(Move<? super SolutionType> move)
        Accept the given move by applying it to the current solution. Updates the evaluation of the current solution and compares it with the currently known best solution to check whether a new best solution has been found. Note that this method does not verify whether the given move yields a valid neighbour, but assumes that this has already been checked prior to deciding to accept the move. Therefore, it should never be called with a move that results in a solution for which Problem.rejectSolution(Solution) returns true.

        After updating the current solution, the evaluated move cache is cleared as this cache is no longer valid for the new current solution. Furthermore, any neighbourhood search listeners are informed and the number of accepted moves is updated.

        Parameters:
        move - accepted move to be applied to the current solution

      • rejectMove

        protected void rejectMove(Move<? super SolutionType> move)
        Rejects the given move. This method only updates the rejected move counter. If this method is called for every rejected move, the number of rejected moves will be correctly reported.
        Parameters:
        move - rejected move
